WorkItem.Description:
I have a problem with using a DataGrid with a column width set to * in a tab control. If the DataGrid is on the selected tab when the window opens, then it works as expected. However, if it is in a non-selected tab, it seems to get confused about how wide the * column should be. Here's an example:
 
<Window x:Class="DataGridTabTest.Window1"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:tools="clr-namespace:Microsoft.Windows.Controls;assembly=WpfToolkit"
        Name="Window"
        Title="Window1" Height="300" Width="300">
    <Grid>
        <TabControl>
            <TabItem Header="Tab1">
                <tools:DataGrid ItemsSource="{Binding ElementName=Window, Path=People}" AutoGenerateColumns="False">
                    <tools:DataGrid.Columns>
                        <tools:DataGridTextColumn Header="First" Width="Auto" MinWidth="80" Binding="{Binding FirstName}"/>
                        <tools:DataGridTextColumn Header="Last" Width="*" Binding="{Binding LastName}"/>
                    </tools:DataGrid.Columns>
                </tools:DataGrid>
            </TabItem>
            <TabItem Header="Tab2">
                <tools:DataGrid ItemsSource="{Binding ElementName=Window, Path=People}" AutoGenerateColumns="False">
                    <tools:DataGrid.Columns>
                        <tools:DataGridTextColumn Header="First" Width="Auto" MinWidth="80" Binding="{Binding FirstName}"/>
                        <tools:DataGridTextColumn Header="Last" Width="*" Binding="{Binding LastName}"/>
                    </tools:DataGrid.Columns>
                </tools:DataGrid>
            </TabItem>
        </TabControl>
    </Grid>
</Window>
 
Where the People property of the window is a simple List<Person> of a simple Person class with first and last name string properties. The first tab displays correctly with the first column taking up at least 80 units and the second column taking up the rest. When you click on Tab2 however, the DataGrid, which was defined identically to the first, has the first column at the same width, but the second column is wider that it should be and horizontal scroll bars appear at the bottom. It appears to be wider even than the DataGrid itself. Click back to Tab1 you can see that DataGrid is still fine.
I've attached the source files for my simple example.
